subject.name: Operating System
subject.description: Provides a comprehensive understanding of operating system concepts, including process and thread management, memory and file management, concurrency, and I/O systems. Emphasizes mechanisms for process synchronization, deadlock handling, and scheduling in modern operating systems.
objectives: To learn the fundamentals of Operating Systems
To understand how OS handles processes, threads, and their communication
To learn the mechanisms involved in memory management in contemporary operating systems
To gain knowledge on distributed OS concepts including mutual exclusion, deadlock detection, and agreement protocols
To understand components and management aspects of concurrency
To learn to implement simple OS mechanisms

units.title: Introduction to Operating Systems
topics: Concept of Operating Systems
Generations of Operating Systems
Types of Operating Systems
Operating System Services and System Calls
Structure of an OS: Layered, Monolithic, Microkernel Operating Systems
Concept of Virtual Machine
Case study on UNIX and WINDOWS Operating Systems

units.title: Processes and Scheduling
topics: Definition and Process Relationship
Different states of a Process and Process State transitions
Process Control Block (PCB)
Context Switching
Threads: Definition, Types, Benefits, and Multithreading Concepts
Process Scheduling: Foundation, Scheduling Objectives, Types of Schedulers
Scheduling Criteria: CPU utilization, Throughput, Turnaround Time, Waiting Time, Response Time
Scheduling Algorithms: Preemptive and Non-preemptive (FCFS, SJF, RR)
Multiprocessor Scheduling and Real-Time Scheduling (RM and EDF)

units.title: Inter-process Communication
topics: Critical Section and Race Conditions
Mutual Exclusion and Hardware Solutions
Strict Alternation and Peterson’s Solution
Producer-Consumer Problem
Semaphores, Event Counters, Monitors, Message Passing
Reader-Writer Problem and Dining Philosopher Problem

units.title: Deadlocks
topics: Definition and Conditions for Deadlock
Deadlock Prevention, Avoidance, and Detection
Banker’s Algorithm
Deadlock Recovery Techniques

units.title: Memory Management
topics: Basic Concepts of Logical and Physical Address Space
Memory Allocation: Contiguous, Fixed, and Variable Partitioning
Internal and External Fragmentation and Compaction
Paging: Principle of Operation and Hardware Support
Segmentation and Paging with Segmentation
Virtual Memory: Basic Concepts, Page Replacement Algorithms (FIFO, Optimal, LRU, NRU, Second-Chance, Working Set Model)
Demand Paging, Thrashing, and Performance Issues

units.title: I/O and File Management
topics: I/O Hardware and Devices
Device Controllers and Direct Memory Access
Interrupt Handlers and I/O Software Structure
Secondary Storage Management: Disk Scheduling (FCFS, SSTF, SCAN, C-SCAN)
Disk Reliability, Formatting, and Bad Block Management
File Management: File Concepts, File Access Methods, Directory Structure, File Allocation Methods (contiguous, linked, indexed)
Free Space Management (bit vector, linked list, grouping)
Directory Efficiency and Performance

suggested_books: Operating System Concepts Essentials, 9th Edition by Avi Silberschatz, Peter Galvin, Greg Gagne, Wiley Asia Student Edition
Operating Systems: Internals and Design Principles, 5th Edition by William Stallings, Prentice Hall of India
Operating System: A Design-oriented Approach, 1st Edition by Charles Crowley, Irwin Publishing
Operating Systems: A Modern Perspective, 2nd Edition by Gary J. Nutt, Addison-Wesley
Design of the Unix Operating Systems, 8th Edition by Maurice Bach, Prentice Hall of India
Understanding the Linux Kernel, 3rd Edition by Daniel P. Bovet and Marco Cesati, O'Reilly and Associates
